subject: Re: [junit] Guidelines/Best Practices for writing JUnit Test cases
msgSnippet: ... I read the first hit article. It had so many errors in it, I got sick. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your guide to software
messageBody:
Joe Schmetzer wrote:

> On Tue, 4 July, 2006 9:00 am, Harshal Shah wrote:
> > Are there some guidelines/Best practices for writing good JUnit Test
> > cases?
> >
> > Any pointers would be helpful
>
> The following search returned some pretty good hits:
>
> http://www.google.com/search?q=junit+best+practices
> <http://www.google.com/search?q=junit+best+practices>
>
> Good luck!

I read the first hit article. It had so many errors in it, I got sick.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
